Reviews.Title: Impressive Picture and Brightness
Reviews.Author: Jonathan VanOsten "jvo"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV a little bit over a month ago and have put in about 100 hours of viewing I would guesstimate.  After that time I would say the TV has an incredible picture.  Some people said the color variation was a little off but I haven't seen this.  I did setup the custom picture setting by using the THX video optimizer included with newer pixar movies and star wars films.  This made a big difference in overall picture quality and was very easy to do.  The brightness of this display is impressive even when first turned on.  The CCFL backlight seems to come to full brightness very quickly and evenly distributes the brightness extremely well.  Color representation appears to be dead on with all types of media (cable, blu-ray, dvd, ps3, xbox).  The motion plus feature is great when watching sports but can cause some juddering effects while watching non-sport content.  The response time for video games is also a plus with no visible judders but this is with game mode turned on.  The tv really does have the deepest blacks I have ever seen on a LCD panel, especially one that is not LED backlight.  I have options turned on to increase blacks and increase the degree of difference between light and dark areas of the screen. Blu-rays look absolutely stunning and upconverted DVDs look pretty good.  I use an external audio system so I can't really comment on the sound of the TV but I would imagine it's on par with other TVs.  All in all it is an awesome TV with a very solid build and great looks.  The TV has a lot of inputs which is a plus and the TV guide is great (if you would use it).  The only other thing I would like is to see the TV with a glossy display to see if the color pops even more.  I would definitely recommend this TV but would also recommend taking some time to setup the picture settings and experimenting a bit to see what looks best for the type of content your viewing.

Reviews.Title: Sony 46xbr6
Reviews.Author: JJC "Jim"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Sony 46XBR6 from Amazon.com  Sony wins hands down on Value,and Quality,over other brands.The TV that I am replacing is a Sony (18 yrs of service and still works very good). Amazon.com  is the best to deal with,not only the best pricebut they sell quality items.I received my XBR in 5 days, the Free White Glove Delivery via Pilot Freight was the Best Service I ever had,They delivered to my home,ask what room did I want the Sony in.The driver offered to  un-pack it. Amazon is most Honest,during shipping there was a price drop, I called customer service and within one minute they adjusted my purchase price,emailed me a credit for the lower price. And they have real live people to talk to.Very Happy with Sony and Amazon.com,"I will be back"

Reviews.Title: Defective remote
Reviews.Author: Orest "Sony fan??"
Reviews.Content: Sony xbr6, 46 inch version: very fine picture, but troublesome remote.  The "Jump" function does not always work. The TV displays the message Now Tuning but the channels do not switch.  This was a problem I also had with the Sony Z-series TV this summer and that is why I traded for the XBR6. A Sony repair man was sent to "professionally evaluate" the TV.  He replaced the main circuit board and remote sensor.  This did not solve the problem.  He then told me that he cannot repair the unit by replacing any more parts.  He called Sony directly from my home and told them the same.  I was promised some contact from Sony.  It has not happened.  After several more calls to Sony, I got promises of return calls which did not come.  Now I have a defective unit that according to the repair tech cannot be fixed and Sony is not responding to my concerns.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing
Reviews.Author: Gregory K.
Reviews.Content: As the title states, this set is simply amazing. This set is replacing my 32" KDL-32S3000, which was also a fantastic TV, just a little too small for my new residence.Anyway, the color is gorgeous, and the picture quality is astounding. The sound is alright, as is to be expected from small in-cabinet speakers. Sony's PS3-esq menu system is a nice touch. The TV actually uses the second revision of it, so it makes a little more sense on this one than it did on the older models.Feature set is great as well. Sony has a lot of nice little touches on this unit really help it stand out. The logo glows, for example, but you can shut it off. In the off setting, it still lights up when the TV is powered on or off, but it gently fades out after a few seconds. Ambient light sensor to control the brightness is a nice, as well as the built-in (and free) TV Guide (though I presume this would be less useful for folks using a cable box).The remote is nice - just like the rest of the bravia line, and it has a programmable backlight too. It will function as a universal remote, and has the buttons to control a VCR or DVD player as well.All in all, this is a fantastic set, and I'm very excited to continue to use it.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect!
Reviews.Author: N.P. Amazon "nefferino"
Reviews.Content: Just got my very own last week. The picture is excellent, sound is good (though I use my surround sound), sleek look and perfect color! Can't say enough about the picture quality. I've seen comparative models at the store and they're inferior in color quality. I have Wii, PS3, DVD, hooked up to it and they all look very crisp and clear, especially the PS3 (blu-ray)!

Reviews.Title: Great Choice 46XBR6
Reviews.Author: Looking2RetireKY
Reviews.Content: Purhcased the 46XBR6 from HHGregg for $ 2100 (Black Friday) after they took another $ 100 off the advertised price.  Love "picture and picture" (used a splitter to connect cable into HDMI and into antenna). Picture quality is suberb for the HD channels that my cable company provides.  The sony blueray ($200) is unbelievable in picture quality.  Setup was a little ackward, but after installing and getting used to the remote, all is well.  Can't go wrong with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Premium Price
Reviews.Author: Pelican Fan
Reviews.Content: We got the Sony Bravia 46XBR6 for an early Christmas present.  We are very happy with it.  The resolution is great on HD channels, though it took a little while to get used to the non-HD channels...you can now see all the flaws and defects in the broadcast signals.  :-)The 'white-glove' delivery service was very good.  The delivery was earlier than originally expected!  They called to schedule a delivery time.  I did the setup myself...but the drop off was great.  They did the unpack and verified that everything was working before they left.Our family room has lots of windows, which is one reason I went for the LCD and the Sony in particular.  It has a bright and colorful screen and can easily handle a bright room setting.The viewing angle does make a difference.  The picture is better with straight on viewing.  While the picture is still good at an angle, it takes a little time to get used to it.Some reviewers had complained about the onscreen menus being too complex, but I have found them easy to navigate.  The paper manual is lacking in detail for some of the more advanced features.The set actually has some great features that are not well explained by the product description above.  Not well documented in the manual either.Here are a couple of examples:  * You can load digital photos on a flash drive and plug the flash drive directly into the TV's USB port to do a slideshow on the TV...no PC required.  * The TV has an ethernet port and you can connect over ethernet to a media server to directly play movies, show photos, or play music on the media server.  The documentation is not very good on this but it is a cool feature.  * You can plug your laptop into the TV (you have to buy the cables separately) and play movies off the Web on the TV through the laptop in Real time.  I did this with a documentary on Netflix and the resolution and refresh rate were good, but I haven't figured out how to get the picture to come up full size yet. It comes up as a box in the center of the screen (about 2/3 of the screen).Here are a couple of things that I wish were better:  * It should have wireless ethernet rather than just a hardwire port.  I have found some converters, but that adds more expense.  Running cables isn't an appealing option when I already have a wreless network in the house.  * The documentation is poor on some of the more advanced features, e.g. networking.  I am a fairly technical person and have been able to figure it out but wouldn't recommend this to the technically challenged...call Geek Squad or an IT savvy friend if you want to set it up.Overall, we are happy with the purchase and would do it again.  The Sony quality is as good as ever and the Amazon purchase and delivery experience was great.

Reviews.Title: Review of perfection
Reviews.Author: Rogi
Reviews.Content: I have always purchased Sony televisions because of their quality and the reliability.  The Sony Bravia XBR KDL-46 from the quality perspective is as good as it gets.  Crystal clear HI DEF and the non-HI DEF shows an amazing improvement also.  Obviously, I cannot comment on the reliability at this point but the Sony it replaced was 25 years old and fault free.  A word of caution in choosing your service provider.  Make sure that they do not interfere with the functionality of your television.  Specifically, your PIP capabilities. My new cable provider has helped me around this problem (thanks to the multiple inputs of the TV) but it is still not to the perfection it should be.  I could not be happier with Amazon, the set arrived as scheduled, undamaged with the "White Glove" handler very helpful and courteous. By the way, the price I paid was cheaper than the manufacturer and all the big-name electronics stores.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tv!
Reviews.Author: Bryan P
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for about a mo. now and I'm still blown away.  The clarity and color on this tv is simply amazing.  If you want a great tv, I would buy this tv, especialty with the way prices are dropping on tv's.  I would also suggest, if you're going to invest in this type of tv, that you have it calibrated.  I definitely noticed a big difference,ie, better picture quality and color saturation, than before I had it done. I promise, you will not regret purchasing this beautiful tv.

Reviews.Title: Serious auto-dimming issues.
Reviews.Author: TV Man "TV Man"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV last week.  I have already updated the software on my TV.  When watching content that alternates between light and dark scenes, the auto dimming creates an experience that is frustrating to watch; switching on and off.  This makes calibrating this TV impossible.  There are no current options to turn this so called "feature" off.  I understand the purpose of this feature to to increase the dynamic contrast ratio of the TV, but when the TV is displaying a dark scene with sparse light the auto dimming on the TV engages and makes the image difficult to see.  It does so in a manner not consistent with the intended viewing of almost all video content displayed on the devise.  This must be resolved.  This is not an isolated occurrence.  I have been in contact with dozens of people that have this TV and it happens on all of them, and it is a major concern to all of them.  There are numerous devises that directly compete with this one and offer a more competitive price point at that.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, Awesome!
Reviews.Author: D. Holloway
Reviews.Content: I have had this now for a little over two weeks, and am blown away by the picture quality.  The reviewer who complained about only one rf antenna input needs to get a new set top box from the cable company or change to a new provider.  I am subscribed to Verizon FIOS in the Maryland suburbs, and their set top box for HD has multiple outputs including an HDMI. This TV has multiple inputs, including a single RF input for off the air or cable; three older yellow, red and white types; two component inputs, 4 HDMI inputs plus a PC and DMeX input.  This should cover everyone's needs. The remote will control up to 4 devices including Verizon's STB, and you can program it tell you what device you are connecting.Overall, I was pleased with the white glove delivery.  The CEVA company out of Odenton said they would deliver it between 10 and 3, but the driver didn't arrive until 5.  In his defense, he said that this was the last of his 22 appointments for that day.  He came in and helped to move the older 32 inch CRT TV, and to set up the SONY.  He didn't leave until the new TV was working properly, which was easily done.So far everything is working perfectly, and if I could, I would give it more than 5 stars.I have been an Amazon purchaser for almost ten years, and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia 46"  XBR6
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Seligman
Reviews.Content: Sony Bravia XBR KDL-46XBR6 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTVThe Sony Bravia KDL-46XBR6 was our choice after a lot of research into HDTVs. The Sony Bravia XBR6 series was best suited to our preferences because of its picture quality, audio quality, and high end feature set. Since picture quality is reviewed by many others, I'll concentrate on the audio and feature sets.Audio: The sound was far and away the best of any of the sets we compared. We do not have a home theatre setup at the moment, so we are relying on the built-in stereo speakers.  The XBR6 projects a clear stereo image with better bass response than you normally get from inboard TV speakers. They claim in the marketing literature that you get a surround-sound type image, but I don't think it lives up to that claim. In addition, there are audio settings that allow you to customize the sound a bit, sort of like a primitive equalizer. Also, there is a cool feature that brings out the voice over other audio on hard to hear movie soundtracks.Feature Set: Mixed reviews here, although still an overall positive. The TV has a USB port, and we have successfully shown slide shows using pictures we brought over from our computer with a flash drive. I would like to have more control over the slide show feature on the TV, which is fairly primitive. We have not been able to get all USB devices to be recognized by the TV.  It seems the more basic, the more likely it will recognize them.We have successfully used the TV as a monitor for a PC. This is simply a matter of connecting the two with an RGB cable. This allows us to display powerpoints and other documents, and display web sites through the computer's wireless capability to the TV.The disappointment has been the networking capability. There is a network port for a wired connection to the network. The device picks up an IP address from the DHCP on the router (this part is for the more technically inclined), but I can't do anything with the device even though I see it on the network. I can ping it, but can't interact with it any other way. I have spent hours on web sites and on the phone with Sony, but noone has been of any help with this. A big disappointment.Otherwise, a great TV. We're enjoying it immensely, and find that it provides a clear image even in our den, which has a glass western wall and gets a lot of afternoon and early evening sun.

Reviews.Title: Nicest I've ever had...
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Richter Jr. "gmurder"
Reviews.Content: This was my x-mas gift to myself. I bought the 46" then tried to make an order change to the 52" but was too late. Amazon had a great deal going at the time, cheapest price I've ever seen on this TV (even cheaper than any sale going on now) and came with a free SONY blue-ray player on top of that. Great sale. TV is very nice. Very sharp picture. Automatically switches inputs for you which I find very nice (when watching TV and you load a DVD, it switches to DVD for you. When you turn DVD off, switches back to TV for you). Viewing angle is as they say it is, about 178 degrees, but as you move to the side the colors fade a lot so it's not a sharp picture from extreme angles. Very nice appearance. It's a fixed stand so you can't turn the TV when mounted but mines on the wall. Very nice set.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Joel Smith
Reviews.Content: This is a long review. Short Version: excellent TV, worth the price, compares favorably to alternatives.I'd caution anyone buying any TV to check out a few other sites before making your decision: [...] will guide you better than any amazon review can. With regards to this TV, here are my thoughts:This (now last generation) LCD TV is very, very good. LCD technology has progressed soundly and always seems to pass the bounds of what seems possible (at least, in my expectations). There is very little motion blur anymore for most applications, the image is crisp, SD images are getting better and overall things just look great. This TV is no exception and delivers top notch performance on every level, with only a few qualms.The picture:The picture is excellent with deep blacks (but not the deepest) and very good color accuracy. There are many different configurations you can change beyond the standard set that will make the job of adjusting the TV to the proper values a little difficult, but once it's set, you should be good for most situations.  Out of the box, the picture looked great as well, but was simply too dark for me. If you look around on AVSforum, you should be able to find some configurations for this TV set.The Sound:The TV comes with a removable sound bar to impart greater sound than a typical LCD set. This might be the case, I don't know. I use a surround sound system that doesn't go through the TV speaker. We used this tv's sound briefly, but it doesn't compare to a surround sound set up pretty much ever. Bottom line: if you're using the TV speakers on any LCD/Plasma right now, these speakers will be at least as good as those.The Remote:Another "I don't use this" section. I use a Logitech Harmony remote (550) to control all of my components, so I'm not sure how good the included sony remote is. It seems like it's a fine remote, with all of the necessary buttons. I haven't heard of the remote breaking on anyone, so I'm guessing it's in the "good enough" category.The Interface (the menu layout/control scheme):Sony uses the cross bar interface on this TV which on first glance/first use really isn't that great. The good news is that as you use the cross bar, you'll like it more. It's simple, easy to use, and fairly easy to find things. It's not particuarly pretty, but not so ugly that you'll want to avoid using it. It's entirely functional, and what more can you really ask for? The included features and adjustments are many, and you shouldn't have a hard time enabling or disabling any feature you like or dislike.Some other notes:120Hz: Personal opinion: looks bad. I'd recommend turning off this feature for most shows/movies/whatever. Some stuff does look fine though (sports, mostly), and I think people can get used to the weird effect it makes. This TV has 3 levels: High/low/off. Low works fine, but again, you're better sticking with off.LED Backlighting ("LED TV"): This TV doesn't have this, and it looks like most of the higher end TVs in the new/current generation will have this. These TVs don't really look that much better than this TV, and the viewing angle tends to be worse. For me, the price differential doesn't make up for the supposed benefits of these TVs.Plasma Vs LCD: both of these technologies are getting better all the time. At this point, it really doesn't matter which you choose, both will look great. I chose an LCD TV because I wanted the longer lifespan, and no risk of burn in. The colors on this TV are already excellent and the motion blur on this TV is pretty unnoticable as well. If you're hung up over this, try going to a store and comparing in person.Shortcomings:There's really only been one issue with this TV, and that's that it's got a feature where the picture will adjust to the colors on the screen. If it's a dark scene, the backlighting/picture will dim, and if it's a bright scene the blacklighting/picture will get brighter. Sounds fine in theory, but this change is slow and noticable in some movies and shows. Most get used to this effect, but it's a deal breaker for others. A firmware update in the future could correct this, but for now (as far as I know) it's there.Final thoughts:As I've said before, this TV is very good and I would highly recommend this TV to anyone I knew that was looking for a new, topish of the line TV. With the current/new generation of TVs coming out, it will lose some of it's luster, but the TV is still quite solid. The inevitable comparison will be against a Samsung A750 TV, and it compares quite nicely. A Samsung A750 S panel will probably look as good as this TV for a little less. Compared to the slightly lower Z series TV (Sony Z4100), this TV adds a little for a little more. Better contrast ratio, better sound, arguably nicer framing, potentially a few less issues overall for a slightly higher price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Frank Hernandez
Reviews.Content: I just got my 46XBR6 yesterday and I tested it out. First was regular cable through the coaxial cable hook-up. That looked very good and I was impressed. Then I hooked up my digital cable box via HDMI and tried that input! WOW! I was floored at how good the NCAA tournament looked! I felt like I was in the arena watching the game live. What was a blur (players faces and sneakers) in the coaxial hook-up, was crystal clear via HDMI. Let it be said for those who simply do not know any better, without HDMI you may think you're watching HD content, but you are not! Oh my goodness! Every HD channel was amazing! Then I fired up my PS3 via HDMI and the games were amazing! BluRay was mind blowing!I then looked for dead pixels, flashlights, smearing, clouding, and all that other stuff you guys seem to complain about, and I saw nothing of the sort. Mine was manufactured in February 2009, so that's probably why. Or I guess I'm just lucky! Never the less, I am extremely happy with my purchase and the price ($1649) I got off Amazon through J&R; Music & Computer World was a super deal. I'm glad I was able to get it when I did! This TV is amazing and I would recommend it to anyone who is on the fence about getting it!

Reviews.Title: Pleased with the Sony XBR6
Reviews.Author: Thomas Williams "Tech Leader"
Reviews.Content: After two months of reading in varuios blogs, especially the AVS forum, and driving many miles to see dozens of sets in showrooms, I finally decided on the Sony 46XBR6. Amazon ordering was easy and delivery was quick including "white glove" where they brought it to my second story room, opened the box, and set it on the table.There were many warnings on the blogs about inherent problems with LCDs. Almost all of them were about impurities in dark scenes. I carefully examined this set, and I dont know if I was lucky, but its black screen was excellent. Later I purchsed a setup blu ray disk and made some adjustments. The picture is stunning, most especially from a blu ray movie, but also from high quality material off-the-air.I also bought the Sony 550 blu ray player and SP2230 home theater. Those units and the TV work together seamlessly. You can open the blu ray, put in a disk, close it, and the TV turns on, switches to the blu ray, the home theater comes on, also in the right settings, and the show begins. Sony sure does a lot of things right. Yes, you pay more for Sony, but I ended up with an excellent experience from a somewhat nervous purchase decision.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: RetAF
Reviews.Content: It took some adjusting to get the picture that I wanted.  Once I turned the light sensor (auto dimming) off, the picture really came to life.  I used/tweaked some of the calibration settings that are available online and now the picture is fabulous.  It is really amazing how good it is.  Even the sound from the speakers is pretty good.  The only negative comment is the narrow viewing angle.  If you get more than about 40 degrees off straight on, the color intensity drops off noticably.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia
Reviews.Author: Joan Q. McAfoos
Reviews.Content: This TV is exceptional in every way.  The color and picture are perfect, clear and you feel like you are on the field during the Pittsburgh Steeler games.  We have it hooked up to a Bose system and the sound is awesome.  Would highly recommend this TV if you have HD access on your satellite or cable.

Reviews.Title: non accurate primary colors
Reviews.Author: Apark
Reviews.Content: I own 46" XBR6 for about 3 weeks now, I use this as a monitor from time to time and find primary colors somewhat inaccurate. Though I have to say this display does provide POP people ask for. I have not played any blu-ray movies so can't comment on that but pretty sure it would look great. Black levels are much better than I expected from an LCD. Even SDTV feed from cable looks better than expected but not for all programming so I can firmly say that upconversion process is pretty good. I did not see any motion blur while watching football. My initial comment about non-accurate color is more evident when you have another TV/monitor side by side (i have 21" NEC Professional series CRT next to my 46XBR6), otherwise it would be hard to tell for most people as my wife and friends were not able to see inaccurate primary colors until i turned my NEC.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia XBR KDL-46XBR6 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: S. Sillari
Reviews.Content: This thing is beautiful and a perfect size. No glare. Wonderful picture. Very easy to set up. I own a lot of Sony products and I have never had any problems with any of them. I love it and so does the whole family.

Reviews.Title: Better than anything you have now
Reviews.Author: B. Miller
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your life worrying about which LCD is better than the others.  Get either a Samsung or a Sony and you won't be disappointed.  Once you get it in your house, it will look a thousand times better than your prior TV, so just pull the trigger and be done with it.  The High Def channels are amazing but it does have some issues with black on black, make some adjustments until you see what you like.

Reviews.Title: Incredible picture
Reviews.Author: buzzard6 "bz"
Reviews.Content: I had originally planned to get a Panasonic plasma 50 inch. I had 3 sony's before and all had great pictures and i didn't want risk getting less quality. In came the46 XBR. I bought it as a floor model and saved a ton of money. I hooked it up in 10 minutes. The picture at first was great but it was very dim. I called sony the next day and they said to turn off the light sensor. POW. The picture went from great to incredible. It was bright, sharp, and 3D like. Cable is terific and Blue Ray's are stunning. I put in I Robot and the images looked like I was on the movie set watching it get filmed. The sound is great and sounds like you are in the threatre.

Reviews.Title: Open box purchase of 46xbr6
Reviews.Author: J. Amos
Reviews.Content: Great delivery. No issues or scratches on 'open box' item. Has been working perfectly from the first day of set up. The TV itself is amazing! I have both the Samsung flat screens and Sony and while both are good, the Sony XBR6 really stands out in color, depth and black components.

Reviews.Title: Overall a Good Experience and a Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: E. Nadal
Reviews.Content: I didn't shop around too much for a TV, but like alot of people, did alot of research online.  A while back, an Aquos display at the mall caught my eye, but that was set up with a DVD to show off the display. The Aquos didn't look as good to me at the other stores. At regular stores like Costco, Sam's club, and Best Buy, etc... the Sonys always looked best to me, especially the XBRs which not everyone carried. I narrowed it down to compare the new Samsung LEDs with the Sony XBRs. I saw a new 40" Samsung B6000 next to a Sony 40" XBR6 at Best Buy and the Samsung picture looked only slightly better, but not $600+ better. The Sony was selling for $1,444, and the just-out Samsung for like $2100. I decided on the Sony, and Amazon Warehouse Deals had an open box 46" for about the price of a 40". The listing said there were slight cosmetic blemishes on the case.  I was a bit apprehensive, but since amazon had the 30-day return, I went for it. The shipping company was Pilot, and my delivery guy was top-notch. He called one hour before to confirm the address, and plugged the unit in to show it worked. He even called an hour after to check if everything was ok and to remind me to keep the box for 30 days in case of problems. I read some people complain of the delivery guys not mounting on the wall, but Pilot mentioned that when they called. Their guys do not mount the TV on the wall for liability reasons, so you have to make arrangements for that yourself. I inspected the TV and could not find any of the cosmetic blemishes mentioned on Amazon WD. So far the TV works great and looks awesome. Sometimes the reds look a bit too red, but I haven't played with the colors too much yet. That's it as far as the imperfections for me. I haven't hooked up a DVD/Blu-ray player yet, but every HD channel looks lifelike, and the non-HD (and HD) channels look better than my dad's Panny Vieria plasma. I'm sure with a picture this good the Blu-rays will be breathtaking! The sound is sufficient for a bedroom, though in larger spaces I could see wanting a theatre system to fill the space. Overall I'm very happy with the TV and this one should suffice for a few years! 5 stars for the TV and Amazon Warehouse Deals!

Reviews.Title: LCD died after 15 months - no extended warranty
Reviews.Author: J. Watson "Pragmatic Enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: You better buy an extended warranty. My LCD screen died after 15 months - 3 months out of warranty. It costs more to replace the LCD panel than it does to buy a new one. The service tech says he gets 50% of his calls on bad panels. Amazon checkout "hiccuped" and I didn't get the extended warranty added the 2nd time through and now I'm screwed. SONY SUCKS!! Buy Sanyo, LG, anything but Sony.

Reviews.Title: Sony 46" KDL46XBR HDTV
Reviews.Author: Ralph E. Hunsaker
Reviews.Content: This is one fantastic HDTV...very much worth the $$$.  Buying through Amazon was just great, best price, quick & precise e-mail confirmations, and shipping was the best, I will do business via Amazon very often...a great company.Thank You.

Reviews.Title: outstanding picture and sports games are beautiful.
Reviews.Author: PBL "PBL"
Reviews.Content: This TV is everything I was hoping for.  Great clarity.  Fast movements aren't blurred.  Crystal clear images, text, everthing.  Easiest to set up with plug ins clearly marked and accessible.  Out of the box and turned on in a matter of minutes.  HDMI cables help with the setup too.  I would definetly buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but the finest HD TV
Reviews.Author: B Thornton
Reviews.Content: I purchased my 46XBR6 from Amazon after doing an extensive review of HD product specifications and watching the real thing. After seeing the TV in full living color and weighing the benefits of Sony's "Bravia" sync I ordered a Sony Blue Ray player which was a gift from Amazon/Sony at the time and a Sony Home Theatre system. I have all three components and my HD cable box linked through the Home theatre system receiver and found it very easy to access many applications with a minimum of button pushing and adjustment.The Amazon delivery was great, on schedule and the delivery person assembled the TV and removed the carton and wrapping components. The total Amazon price was much less than any of my local shops including Best Buy.An Amazon deal is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Sony XBR6 Great Choice, excellent Deal!
Reviews.Author: K. Allison "HS_TECH_TEACHER"
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research when looking for TVs. The TVs I was looking at were the Z series Sony, Samsung 650/750, and Panasonic Plasma.  I decided not to go with the plasma since I had a lot of light in the room where the TV was going to be.  I read through a ton of reviews and decided to finally go with the xbr6 for a few reasons: one, with a ton of reviews and the consumer reports best buy, the Samsung seemed to have a lot of reliability issues that popped up.  This is my third Sony TV and I have never had a problem with any of the others over the course of 12 years. Two, the deal from Amazon was ridiculously good with the purchase of the blu-ray player.  The last was the features of the XBR6, 1080P, 120Hz, Sony video processing.Delivery: I have read, people had so-so experiences, and some bad.  My experience was excellent! I received and email with a number to call to set up the installation.  CEVA came early in the time frame they specified. They had told me in the earlier phone call that they were super busy and would only have one delivery person so I would have to help bring it in. It wasn't a huge deal for me since I was home anyway.  TV is only 60lb, so manageable for most.  Once inside, the delivery guy unboxed the TV put the TV on its stand put the screws in and plugged in to test.  Then he offered to take the box with him. Overall a great experience.  I have seen some complaints of this service but you look at FREE delivery, and no taxes vs. buying at a bigbox store and this is EXCELLENT!Picture settings:  have Dish and hooked everything up with 1.3 HDMI cables. I have the Sony BDP-S550 blu-ray player to go with it. The Blu-Ray movies look stunning to say the least.  Make sure you press the "theater" button to get the best image, otherwise it looks too real.  As far as the other settings, the vivid looks the best to me, but make sure you check out [...] and read about the settings for movies on cinema.  Makes a big difference especially when you turn off the light sensor.My father in-law purchased the Samsung 650 46" and comparing side-by-side, I would say the image is very comparable, I dont like the TOC red and the glossy screen.  The Sony matte screen is much better with reflection IMHO.Sound, I LOVE IT.  I have the Yamaha 663 receiver, but the sound bar is incredible for how small it it.  The tone is good and produces excellent sound as far a TV sound goes. For movies I go with my Yamaha, but for everyday watching the sound it great.If you are looking at a great HDTV, this is the ticket, you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia XBR KDL-46XBR6
Reviews.Author: R. Doolan
Reviews.Content: We searched a long time and visited many stores to compare the picture of Sony with other brands then searched the Sony web site to learn about their various models.  We selected this one in part because of the 120Hz refresh rate.  I also like to use picture with picture.  Delivery service was on time and the driver was helpful unpacking and setting it up.  He wanted to turn it on to demonstrate it.  I think this was a bad idea since it was delivered on a cold day in January.  I chose to let it get to room temperature before plugging it in.  The set up was easy.  After about a week, I got around to hanging it on the wall.  Picture quality is good.  I have not played with the fine tuning of the picture and may not bother since it looks good as is.  There is a delay when switching channels, inputs, or toggling the sound between the 2 pictures when using picture and picture.  I'm pleased with the performance and satisfied with Amazon's price.  I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: R. Roberts
Reviews.Content: I'm using FIOS with this TV and the picture is awesome. The sound quality is very good.  The picture quality is especially noticeable on people's faces. Color and subtle shading looks perfectly natural. Not that blotchy effect you see with some TVs.  The picture quality you see in stores is often not as good as what I'm seeing with FIOS. This makes comparison shopping very difficult. So I can't make any meaningful comparisons to other brands.This TV has some slight blurring in fast action sports. I don't notice it in basketball. It is most noticeable in hockey.  Occasionally the puck will disappear momentarily on a fast slap shot. Not so on my old standard CRT TV.  But the vast improvement in overall picture quality is breathtaking.  This TV has a three position motion enhancement option (off, standard, and high).  I can't tell any significant improvement at any setting.  The fact the TV even has this option confirms there are challenges getting fast motion to look right.  But my wife doesn't notice the blurring problem.  I've never noticed any pixilation.The sound quality is very good - much better than I expected.  I have high-end speakers, but don't feel the need to bother turning them on in most cases.The brightness of the TV is great - even in my brightly lit room.  It has four picture settings that are increasingly bright (cinema, custom, standard, and vivid).  My preference is usually custom and occasionally standard.  This TV has a frosted finish on the screen that minimizes glare which was a major factor in my choosing Sony over the Samsung which has a very glossy screen.No problems with the shipment.  It was delivered ahead of schedule - even during Christmas rush - and in perfect condition.This TV went on sale right after I bought it.  Amazon politely refused to refund the price difference.  Curiously, Amazon would let me return it and reorder at the lower price, but that was just too much trouble at a busy time of year.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD TV
Reviews.Author: CIC44
Reviews.Content: I've owned the Sony 46XBR6 for about a month and have nothing but praise for it.  The TV was very easy to set up; within minutes I had the cable box, a Nintendo Wii and DVD player hooked up with HDMI and component cables.  The TV remote is very easy to operate as well.As for the picture quality, it is second to none. Sports, concerts, documentaries, and my favorite TV shows pop with amazing color and detail.  I knew that the XBR series was known for its top-notch picture quality, but I am honestly surprised at how amazing the HD picture quality is on this TV.If you are in the market for an LCD HDTV do yourself a favor and check the 46XBR6 out in person - you will not be disappointed.  The XBR6 is worth every penny I spent on it, and I'm sure you will feel the same way once you have one in your home.

Reviews.Title: Sony = BAD
Reviews.Author: Peter Karns
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after being talked into it by the salesperson. I had gone in with the intention of buying a Sharp Aquos. The TV was a better price, but certainly NOT a better product. I trusted the Sony name, and the salesperson. One mistake on top of another.  TV lasted less than three years, and now it is beyond economical repair. After a month of communication with Sony their offer was to sell me a refurbished TV for the same price as the repair. HAH!Sony products used to be quality, but like so many things these days they're actually just disposable. Don't buy Sony. Their products are inferior, and their customer service is non existent.

Reviews.Title: Must Have Sony Bravia LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Barrett J. Galpern
Reviews.Content: While shopping for the Sony Bravia KDL-46XBR6 LCD TV, I did look around for other brands. Had decided that this model is the best ever came across. Sony, a great job well done for developing this amazing product-great picture, sound, and controls!!!!

Reviews.Title: Simply stunning television!!
Reviews.Author: Warren W. Wiley
Reviews.Content: I thought I had seen state-of-the-art TV's ,including time in the TV broadcasting business, but this set is simply stunning!! By coincidence, as we set it up there was a broadcast of  live images from  Hubble Telescope.  As the picture locked on the screen it took our breath away!! It made you feel as though you were floating through space.That was several months ago and even today one of us will stop in mid stride, look at the TV and remark,  "What a GREAT picture!"Do yourself a favor:if your family really enjoys watching TV...stretch the budget if you have to and buy this SONY Bravia. It is an incredible achievement by SONY.

Reviews.Title: great T.V.
Reviews.Author: Lola Star
Reviews.Content: This is out third Sony XBR  T.V.  We believe it to be the best .  Our first one is @ 10 years old and never gave any problems.If you are looking for quality and a good picture this is the T.V. that you need or  any other size in the XBR line.  This is a XBR 6  The best is the XBR 8.for picture quality.....but also it is a lot more expensive.So for an affordable T.V. this is the one to get.............

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Michael Mcdermott
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with the picture. The sound is average at best (as with any flat screen). Try to make room in your budget for a/v receiver and 5.1 speakers if possible. I went from a crt 27" to this unit as well as surround and can't believe what i've been missing. I watch a lot of sports and movies. Football and hockey look absolutely amazing now i'm waiting for baseball.

Reviews.Title: It's a SONY
Reviews.Author: Glenn Watkins
Reviews.Content: After careful research, I decided to buy the 46XBR6 from Amazon. They offered free white glove delivery and a nice low price. The shipping company was the absolute worst! They showed up 3.5 hrs early and got me out of the shower. They didn't even want to wait for me to get dressed. I called the shipping company and complained but never heard another thing. The TV is absolutely gorgeous and meets every expectation. I should have gotten the 52" instead since I have enough room. Oh well, maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Techie "Technology Nut"
Reviews.Content: Just purchased directly from amazon.com. TV has an awesome picture and a lot of features. By far the best picture I have seen on any current LCD TV on the market. This TV's sound is like having a high end surround sound system. Amazon.com direct ship went perfect. TV was promised in 5-7 business days and I got mine in 3 business days. Great buy at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Can it get any better??
Reviews.Author: Richard K. Summers "Kevin"
Reviews.Content: I just want to start off with saying that until I purchased this t.v. I've never been a fan of Sony.  For me it seemed that they only made over-priced, mediocre electronics that didn't ever compare to what the rest of the industry was providing.  Yet, after endless research I decided to buy this Sony as our first ever flat screen t.v. and all I can say is WOW!!  I've seen HD on countless other flat screens over the years, but this set is by far the best for under $2000.  I was dead set on getting the Samsung 650 for the last 4-5 months because the image was so beautiful in every store I saw them in and it seemed like the best deal for the money (not crazy expensive, but not cheap such as other lesser known brands).  However, i was looking around in a Frye's one day and saw the Sony XBR6 on display right next to a Samsung 650 and was surprised at just how much brighter, clearer and more detailed the Sony was!  They were each running the same video loop and you could easily see that the Sony truly did have much darker blacks than the Samsung (black on all the Samsungs actually looked grey compared to Sony's, which canceled the idea of maybe the 650 just wasn't calibrated correctly).  After searching on Amazon and seeing how they were offering the set for $150 less than anywhere else along with free shipping I decided it was time to get one and I couldn't be happier.  The amount of features and inputs on the XBR6 is amazing.  Whether you get this set or a Samsung you won't be disappointed, but I just had to say how much I love this LCD in case there are others out there like me who just can't get enough info. before deciding to buy a new t.v.

Reviews.Title: Much better than KDL46Z4100
Reviews.Author: J. Zawada
Reviews.Content: We bought both the 46XBR6 and the KDL46Z4100 Series. Although the Z-Series has a slightly bigger viewing angle, the picture of the Z-Series can't even come close to the XBR6. With both of them hooked-up receiving the same signal (DirectTV) the XBR6 had unbelievable clarity almost 3D like.While the Z-Series seemed to struggle to process the signal. If we just hooked up the Z with nothing to compare it to, we probably would of been happy with the picture, but after hooking up the XBR6 we went from being happy to being amazed. Needless to say the Z went back to the store and the XBR6 is here to stay.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Chad P. Dow
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. Excellent picture quality and color depth. Blacks are deep, especially for an LCD TV. You will never want to watch standard definition TV again though!!Delivery is also excellent. I can't believe it was free. They delivered the TV, brought it in, and set it up. Remember to keep the box, though, just in case you have any issues with the TV.If you are considering purchasing this TV, do it without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: Big Mistake???
Reviews.Author: Beaker
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY NOT! Had a problem with a 32" tv so sent it back and decided to go big and high quality. While I waited for this tv I thought I made a big mistake. I knew I would like the big but thought the high quality part could have just been a waste of money. Wrong! This tv is amazing and along with the Amazon price and a free Blu Ray player, am very happy with this purchase. I never thought I would buy an item like this online and have it shipped, but was all very easy with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia 46"
Reviews.Author: doug29
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find the right HDTV and settled on the Sony 46" XBR6. It arrived quickly and I was able to set it up in less than 30 minutes. It has a beautiful picture and good audio.  The price I got at Amazon (been a customer for 10 years) beat everything in stores and on the internet. I did buy the 4 year warranty package directly from Sony and got a good deal on that also.I also ordered a high def Sony DVD Player from Amazon which showed up almost immediately. It took about 10 minutes to unpack and hook up so now I have a great home entertainment center.I have checked several times since Christmas and the Amazon price is still very competitive.I have now gotten to the point, if I need something and it is on Amazon, I just buy it knowing if I have a problem, they will take care of it.Sony Bravia XBR KDL-46XBR6 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: AMAZED
Reviews.Author: M. M. Van Agtmael
Reviews.Content: We have two other Sony Bravias but just purchased this model (as an upgrade) - so we really can view the difference in the product.  Amazed at clarity, quality and definition.  Invited friends over to get their reaction - they all had the same response.  Would definitely recommend upgrading to this model.  Beautiful color and picture.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia XBR46 HDTV
Reviews.Author: Love to Read
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the TV, great picture, easy to use.  It's a great size for the room...we sit about 11 feet away from the TV.  The delivery was very fast, ordered on Jan. 18th, and it was delivered on Jan. 22.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Walter Obando "Spy Master"
Reviews.Content: I was looking to upgarde from the old tube style TV and Ammazon helped me all the way. Great price, great service and most of all great viewing in my living room. That is why I shop Amazon because you cannot beat their delivery and prompt service. Way to go.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LCD
Reviews.Author: Zimzebob
Reviews.Content: The XBR arrived on time in excellent condition. The 10 bit color results in a picture that is dramatically superior  to my 32" XBR. The only problem was that while the delivery man/installer knew how to connect it to the satellite receiver, he was unable to connect it to my Bose surround sound system. In summary, the Sony 46"XBR met or exceeded my expectations. An unexpected benefit is that it is actually smaller than a previous 42" plasma due to its very trim border.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Boozer
Reviews.Content: This television is just plain awesome!  If you can get this television for uder $2000, buy it!  This is the best television you can get for the price.  The picture is crystal clear and installation was easy.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This TV - Bleeding Blacks
Reviews.Author: Sqwibbs
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace my 46" Westinghouse, which I was actually very happy with. Unfortunately, the PS3 has flickering issues with some TV's (Sony's fault, as I understand it), so I decided to "upgrade" to the Sony. On paper this is an awesome TV. In reality I wish I had kept my Westy.First minor gripe is that the "Cinimotion" feature is TERRIBLE. It makes everything look like it was shot on a handy cam. Fortunately you can turn this off.My biggest problem (and why I will never buy a Sony again) is that this TV has black bleeding problems. For example: I was watching Top Gear last night and Hammond was driving a white pickup truck across America. When the truck was standing still it looked fantastic, but when it was in motion the black wheel wells where bleeding into the white paint job. Another time this becomes a problem is when people on the screen have dark hair and light skin. When they move their head their hair blurs into their face.The effect is especially visible in video games where there are sharp lines between objects on the screen. For example: in Forza 2 the cars in front of you blur their way around corners. It is very distracting.I have tried changing virtually all of the settings to try and correct this issue. I even had a friend who owns an XBR4 come over because he thought I must have the TV set up wrong. I am technically adept and I am used to working with technology (I even have a Bachelors in computer science) so it's not like I'm just some old fart who can't figure his TV out. The fact is that my Westy did not have these issues and my double-the-cost Sony does.I am very unsatisfied with this TV and I will be ditching it ASAP and buying a Samsung (or another Westy, if the PS3 firmware fixes the flicker issue).

Reviews.Title: TV's Great, "White Glove" Service isn't
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: The 46" Sony TV works good, but does need some adjustment to the picture.  I've tried to make adjustments exactly as the manual instructs, but to no avail.  No big deal, but I guess I'll have to call the service dept.  Now on to what really bothers me....  The promise of "White Glove" delivery.Our new TV was delivered on Dec. 23, 2008 at 5:45PM.  We paid for and expected "White Glove" delivery service.  What we got was ONE individual who was "sorry" that he was unable to install the TV (Sony 46") on a new TV stand we purchased because it was too big for him to handle alone. (I offered to help.)  We had EVERYTHING set up and ready for the installation.  What the delivery people (we expected more than one guy)had to do was attach two brackets to the back of the TV and hang the TV on the stand.  Really, no big deal. The individual again was "sorry", but he was only able to do a "standard" set-up.  I guess the standard set-up consisted of placing the TV on a table and walking away.  We ended up doing the job ourselves, and disposing of the packing material.Many TV's this big are hung on a wall or onto a stand.  Our request was not unusual, and certainly well within the realm of a customary installation.  You need to retrain your delivery personnel to accommodate a simple installation other than simply placing the purchased TV onto a table.

Reviews.Title: XBR6 = Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Dave K.
Reviews.Content: The White Glove Service left a little to be desired.  They were running several hours late and wanted to get in, unpacked and out as quickly as possible.The TV, however, surpasses all my expectations.  I've read several reviews about the blacks having "clouds" or streaks of light.  Nothing like that on ours and the Blu-Ray disks are more clear than going to a theater.

Reviews.Title: Initial Review
Reviews.Author: Syed Taqvi
Reviews.Content: I ordered on 1/5/09. Set was delivered today 1/9/09. So excellent before time delivery.. it was supposed to be arriving next week.The delivery service itself was not upto expectations.Amazon Contracted Pilot Freight, who sub-contracted to William B Meyer.It was scheduled for Friday between 1 and 5, then rescheduled to Friday between 8 and 12. Which is fine, the earlier the better. They did call one hour before to confirm. Came in by 8:30. So far so good. But it was not 'White Glove' delivery by any stretch of imagination. They got the box in, opened the top, said they could not put it on the stand.How am I supposed to test it if it is not assembled and ready for viewing?? Then said they could not plug it in as it had been lying in the truck all night and the temp was below 30. So it was not advisable. But then the icing on the cake was when the delivery guy wanted me to initial on a page that said I did not want the box to be opened.So now I have a half open box containing a TV lying at home. Still untested of course. I am just hoping that there was no damage in transit and I do not have  to run around for repair/replacement.will update.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - these sets often fail with EXPENSIVE problems
Reviews.Author: Nrasser
Reviews.Content: I bought the KDL46XBR6 from Best Buy about three years ago.  A few months ago the set stopped turning on, and the problem was traced to the "T-Con Board".  This part IS NOT AVAILABLE, from Sony or anyone else.  I now have an expensive piece of toxic waste which I must pay someone to recycle.I used to be a pretty solid Sony TV fan but this insult is a bit too much.  I won't have another one, ever.

Reviews.Title: TV stopped working only after 3-1/2 years.
Reviews.Author: Mehmet G. Yalcin
Reviews.Content: The TV turns off itself and its red stand-by LED light blinks (14) times. Sony wouldn't have a solution for this and the only advise they provided was to contact the local repair shop.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Lindsey
Reviews.Content: The image detail and color of this XBR6 is truly amazing. Another unexpected benefit is the anti-glare screen - we no longer are forced to turn off the overhead lights to watch a movie.I was a little wary of purchasing an expensive HDTV and having it shipped to my house but it arrived in perfect order via FedEx. The installation was extremely simple; I pulled the base out of the box, screwed it to the shelf for stability, and the wife and I mounted the display. In all a 5 minute job. Hooking up surround sound, DVD player, etc was a snap.I would have preferred to purchase locally to support our retailers but just couldn't justify $1300 more.Bottom line is great value, fantastic everything, just no down side to this purchase. My only regret is waiting so long to get it!

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL 46XBR6 from Electronic Express/Amazon
Reviews.Author: Anthony Au "Tony549"
Reviews.Content: I received the HDTV on 27March09 from Electronic Express. It was delivered by Fedex and it arrived in fine condition. I have had no issues with it thus far (late April). We love the clear images and vibrant colors. I have not seen any dead pixels nor any clouding. It works fine with the kids' WII and our DirectTV HDDVR receiver. The price was right for us and the shipping cost was free. I highly recommend the Sony KDL 46XBR6.

Reviews.Title: Good TV.. horrible service (delivery)
Reviews.Author: Narendran Subramanian "Naren"
Reviews.Content: The TV as such was good, but compared to the latest Samsung 7100 series that I saw in Best Buy a week after purchasing this, Sony is not as good. But anyway I did not have enough time and did not want to go through the hassle of returning. Amazon should not claim it as White Glove Delivery anymore. CEVA was the delivery company, the guy was so rude. He came to my house and said like all we do is open the box and test if it is working. I asked him for a favor to put it back in the box, and he was so rude and almost broke the boxes. I was supposed to move to a different place and that is why I asked him to put it back. Then I said I will deal with it and asked that person to leave. It was not a pleasant shopping experience.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia XBR is the real thing
Reviews.Author: M. Gardner
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the Sony Bravia XBR 46 in TV that was recenty purchased from Amazon. The white glove delivery went very well. The delivery was made at the time promised and without any problems. The TV picture is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: JimBo
Reviews.Content: delivered before estimated time line and product was set in designated room ---very satisfied with the service

Reviews.Title: super tv for super good price. amazon rocks
Reviews.Author: P. Dhingra
Reviews.Content: Got this after X'mas for my boys to play 360. But decided to keep it in the living room and gave them my 40" plasma. This has enogh hdmi connectors for all my gizmos. the picture is perfect with the blu-ray player. love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HD Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Kapil Chopra "KC"
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on Watching on Standard Definition signal (4x3) and not HD signals then this TV 46inch like any other out there in the market is not a good choice, buy a smaller TV, but if you have an HD signal and have already upgraded your cable or would upgrade it to HD then nothing can beat the quality of Sony-XBR 46inch. I have not played Blu Ray on this TV or hooket it up to Network but I did play Up-converted 1040i movies from my DVD player and I can tell it rocks. The TV has an Optical Out port, which in my mind is really a great connection (other TVS may have that too but never compared) as this help maintain the audio quality from the Source to the receiver.The only annoying feature of the TV so far I have noticed is that the "Information Bar" takes a lot of time to go away when you turn on the TV. I am talking about the information about the channel, Aspect Ration, Rating etc.. While it is up there on the screen, you can not do anything, can not click the favorites, click Input or as a matter of fact any other function on remote, you got to wait for the information bar to go away. This bar takes 1/3rd of the screen even after changing the setting to "Small" information. On day one the time was shorter but has become longer, I have no clue why but I am still looking in the manual but unable to find any setting. Well this is minor when you look at the quality of the picture.I gave this TV 5 rating because I think I like the TV and secondly everyone says it is the best and thirdly I spent a lot of money on this one. I guess I had to it give it the best rating. You will not be disappointed so go ahead and buy it.Last piece of advice, if you want to take, just don't get carried away by the fact that it is Sony (I did that) and it is OK to pay $500 more for it.KC

Reviews.Title: Does not disappoint
Reviews.Author: VirtualAlaskan
Reviews.Content: Very nice quality. Lots of knobs to play with to get exactly what you want in your picture.

Reviews.Title: Jeff
Reviews.Author: J. Smith
Reviews.Content: Amazon is a great vendor and this Sony LCD lives up up the hype. It replaced a Samsung DLP which is also a very nice TV, however the black and the color contrast is superior on the Sony. It is also much better for daytime viewing or in brighter lighting situations. I am very pleased with the TV and as always with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: we love it
Reviews.Author: jp∓
Reviews.Content: the sony bravia xbr6 kdl 46 inch 1080p has been wonderful. the white glove delivery was excellent. the two delivery men unpacked the television and put it in its stand and told us to wait until it was warm to turn it on. the december delivery caused the need for the warm up. we had our local cable company install a hd-dvr and we were ready to watch. even though one of us is technology challenged, we found the remote easy to use. the picture is excellent and the sound more than adequate. our whole experience using amazon as a vendor was great.

Reviews.Title: Shopping for TVs on line---A First
Reviews.Author: June Allison "Mom"
Reviews.Content: Buying this product was difficult for me from the start because there are so many choices on a subject about which I know relatively little.  I visited a local electronics store and spoke to friends about various brands.  Then I selected what I wanted and compared prices.  Amazon definately offered the best deal with no charge for shipping and no tax in my state.  I am very pleased with my set and your service.

Reviews.Title: Broke after 2 months
Reviews.Author: DG
Reviews.Content: I bought this 2 months ago and it worked great.  Then all of a sudden I get a red line down the middle of the screen and it won't go away.  Looks like it is a dead tv.  I don't live somewhere where I can get it fixed and shipping will be a ton - live overseas.  This thing sucks.  Don't buy Sony.

Reviews.Title: Excellentee
Reviews.Author: Kiran Potluri "Kiran Potluri"
Reviews.Content: Awesome product. Wait for Christams or Thanks giving deals. I got this TV and Sony BDP 550 for $1800 during 08 Christmas at Amazon. Also check xbr 9. Usually 46" and higher have better specifications than smaller size models. Use Amazon Bravia comparison chart for further analysis.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: P. Hogan
Reviews.Content: SO far the TV is all I expected and actually more. Remarkable picture on High Def broadcasts,no complaints what so ever.

Reviews.Title: Best TV i've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Jamison Mergens
Reviews.Content: Best TV I've ever owned is a bit of a misnomer as my last tv was a 20 year old hand me down... but still. I researched for about 3 months all the best tv's, features and plain old quality. By far the 46XBR6 is the best tv available in what I like to call reality land, that being a TV for less that $2,000. Sure, if  I were to spend 10k on a TV, yes, there are better... but for the price, this is hands donw the best available.120Hz, 50,000:1 contrast, more HDMI slots than you probably need and Sony's great name.I purchased mine through amazon warehouse, it was marked used-mint and was really in absolute perfect condition. For a pretty smokin' deal, I'd recommend checking that site out before paying retail.Cheers

Reviews.Title: Bravo
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: This LCD is top notch.  I saved over $1000 compared to the price at the local Best Buy.  The delivery went fine; two nice people brought the TV inside, unpacked it, and set it up on my TV stand.  I was able to throw in a DVD to test it before signing off on the delivery.  (I had this setup ready as a courtesy for the delivery people)The 120hz is definitely the way to go.  The blacks are truly black on this TV, and the color are vivid and bright.I have a PS3 which functions as my Blue-Ray & DVD Player.  Batman Dark Knight (BR) and Hellboy II (BR) look sweet on this TV.  PS3 games look awesome.As a side bonus, the menus for the TV are easy and quick to navigate.  I've had other TVs where it's a pain to change anything--even the video input.I have a receiver and surround sound, so I can't comment on the TV speakers.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: J.P,
Reviews.Content: The quality of this television is amazing. Amazon had an excellent price when we decided to buy. The amazing and natural movement in movies and shows has had many comments from our guests. Shows like the Hulk and Iron Man are better than ever, and we haven't even hooked up the blu ray yet!Our living room is very small. We mounted this TV onto a wall. I believe you should arrange seating for no closer than 7 feet away. We pushed all our furniture back. I had one sofa to the side closer, but watching television (especially when my husband had it on vivid) from too close made my eyes water and gave me a headache.Overall Id have to say this television is better than any Bravia I've seen at stores such as Target, Walmart, Shopko, etc. Its a little more pricey but definitely worthwhile to get an XBR6. You won't regret it once you see the crisp clear picture and motion.

Reviews.Title: Bravia
Reviews.Author: S. Harrison
Reviews.Content: The TV is everything I expected and more.  Was delivered on time and in great condition.  I couldn't be happier!!

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-46XBR6 Review
Reviews.Author: Venkata R. Konakanchi
Reviews.Content: This LCD HDTV, Sony Bravia KDL-46XBR6, renders dark colors as dark enough without pixelizing on color boundaries. The picture clarity and dynamic color contrast from this TV are a great viewing pleasure. The Sound level can be little better but can be adjusted though using a remote.

Reviews.Title: An Amazing Picture!
Reviews.Author: B. Moore
Reviews.Content: This TV was ordered from One Call (through Amazon) and it saved us over $500 from going to the local Best Buy.  I would highly recommend One Call for any electronic purchase.For the TV, the picture is amazing!  I debated spending the extra money on a 52", but I didn't want the living room to be over-powered by such a large TV.  The 46" compliments our living room very well and the clarity in HDTV and Blu-ray is as good as it gets.  We have a Sony 40" S-line Bravia in the bedroom, and while it looks great, there is no comparison to the XBR.  This is a TV I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Perfect LCD!  Great price
Reviews.Author: F. Horner
Reviews.Content: Amazon offered this wonderful Sony LCD television at a super price, and best of all had it available immediately.  I could not find it in stock in any store.  This television has it all.  Its colors are very deep and rich, owing to the 10,000:1 Dynamic Contrast Ratio.  You cannot do any better.Amazon's "white glove" delivery service had one blip, however.  The delivery men at first professed to be unaware of their responsibility to unpack the set and place it in its proper position.  When I said "fine, you leave and I will just call Amazon," their story changed pretty promptly and they did a competent job of unpacking.  So please just be prepared with an internet print-out of Amazon's good policy.

Reviews.Title: KDL-46XBR6
Reviews.Author: Shahin Yavari "Shahin"
Reviews.Content: I love the wide plain, natural and real colors on screen makes it unique. system is user friendly, you only need a good home theater system to have a great set. good and on time delivery and customer care by Amazon too.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Sony makes the best A+++++++++++
Reviews.Author: George Taylor "Tyerone"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best TV ever!!! I had a new rear projection and they suck!!!! the bulb goes after so many hours!! I had the TV for 6 years and changed the bulb 3 times at $299.00 a bulb not a good buy.We will see how this LCD does and I'll let you know in 6 years.But at this point buy sony Great TV WHAT A PICTURE!!!!

Reviews.Title: well pleased
Reviews.Author: Douglas L. Parker "CLOE"
Reviews.Content: I AM WELL PLEASED WITH THIS SONY PRODUCT...PICTURE QUALITY TERRIFIC AND THE OPTIONS ARE AS WELL......LOOKING FORWARD TO GETTING A BLUE/RAY DVD TO GO WITH IT.....DOUG

Reviews.Title: an amazing tv from sony once again
Reviews.Author: inflames
Reviews.Content: i was able to purchase this tv during the black friday specials, i wasnt thinking they would lower the price but they did so without any hesistation i purchased it on the spot at brandsmart. i also noticed it has a usb entry on the side of it , ive been thinking of purchasing a usb flash drive to see how the pictures look on the tv..  for anyone still trying to decide what tv to purchase buy only sony bravia xbr brands and save up like i did.........

Reviews.Title: sony 46xbr4
Reviews.Author: Douglas Martz "loganmartz"
Reviews.Content: Great picture however it has gone to pot after 17 months.No help from Sony. I did not purchase the extended warranty. I thought SONY would be a reliable product. WRONGNever again. The tv has a severe ghost image when turned on and it is getting worse week by week.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Movie Entertainment just Plain watching TV
Reviews.Author: James L. Baker Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV and WOW the picture is magnificant.  I have HD viewing capability and teamed with this TV the experience was heartwarming.  I did not believe the HD TV hype but after viewing HD on this TV it is hard to watch regular TV it is just not clear and vibriant. The sound is great there is no need to get additional speakers with this set.  It has enough plugs component, composent, HDMI in the back for all your satellite TV, cable, DVD players, game sets and you an even hook a computer to it. Get yours soon because Sony is coming out with XBR7 models and the XBR6 will be hard to find.

Reviews.Title: great tv..buy it..its a sony
Reviews.Author: B. sayers
Reviews.Content: i have had for a couple of weeks now and have no complaints...color is great...easy to use...sony quality...picture is awsome...buy it...

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Pawan Kumar
Reviews.Content: I have not stressed this TV too much since I am using a Pioneer AV Receiver which upconverts all video and handles the audio itself. As such it only sees full 1080p signal. So probably some of the satisfaction can be credited to the receiver. I really like the fact that the screen brightens up during the day (at least appears to be significantly brighter and easy to watch even in bright surroundings). On the other hand, I wished it was a little brighter during the night. Yes, I have played with the settings. I also got a good deal on it in the 2-day post-Christmas sale in 2008.

Reviews.Title: BEST TV FOR THE MONEY!
Reviews.Author: mccreepy "mccreep"
Reviews.Content: When i was looking to replace my old tv with a new LCD tv i spent about a month researching different brand tvs. MY search came down to the Sony 46XBR6 and Samsung LN52A750. Both tvs had the features i was looking for in a tv but samsung lost out to sony because i own a lot of sony products and have had ZERO problems with them. Well iv had the tv for 3 days now and i am glad i went with sony! The bravia sync is a god sent, no more having to push the input button when i want to watch a dvd, I just turn on my sony blue ray and the tv does it for me!This will work with any electronics that are compatiable. The picture is the best i have seen,alot of people say that they are getting ghost in their black screens but i have not seen this on mine!let me tell you that if you are a gamer you will not believe how the games look on this tv! Its like going from playstation 2 to 3! its that good! trust me iv been playing for 30 years! Movies are just as impressive!I have 400 dvds of the old format and even when they are upconverted they are amazing! the sound of the  tv is real good,i know alot of people have not been happy with the sound,but I have found that it matters what type of equipment you put though the tv! cheap equipment= bad sound! I can go on and on about why you should choose this tv but believe me when i say that this is a winner! Oh if you are worried about the tv being shipped,dont my tv was fine! not even a mark on the box! thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia XBR KDL-46XBR6
Reviews.Author: Joseph Ranieri
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice TV. The picture is very good and everything about it it is classic Sony QUALITY. Just a few minor remarks: The TV's speakers are located in box allong the bottom which is not as structurally sound as the rest of the TV chasis. Since you are not supposed to lift by the speakers it makes it somewhat awkward to handle the TV. Also just above this box is a clear plastic strip. I did not take this into account when I drilled holes in my wall to run wires to the back of the TV. As a result, I can see the power cord through the clear plastic. I should have drilled them a littele higher.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: C. Konas
Reviews.Content: I looked at several different TV's over several months to upgrade to a flat screen HD.  I finally settled on this one because of different positive reviews, the Sony brand, and it fit my space.  Its awesome.  My kids and friends love it. The set up was very easy.  Amazon was great to work with.  When I finally decided to buy it, I actually ordered from my blackberry. Pretty cool site that works that well on a blackberry.  It delivered before they said and everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: A top notch TV; worth the price
Reviews.Author: R. Henke
Reviews.Content: I have had the TV for about a month and the picture is fantastic.  The colors are rich and the picture is sharp, even with the faster moving action of sports.  I did calibrate the color using the Avia II disk to maximize the accuracy.  The out of the box calibration was less than perfect on my set so I suspect all the units need a little adjustment.The viewing angle color drop-off is evident when you get more than about 30 degrees off center when you have it calibrated right.  If you jack up the color using the "vivid" setting it will look better from the side, but you will lose accuracy in front. The XBR6 is probably not the best choice if you will frequently watch the TV from the side.  But if you are paying close to $2000 for a TV, I hope you plan on watching from in front of it the majority of the time.

Reviews.Title: Trust and best seller!
Reviews.Author: Shaojun Wang
Reviews.Content: I ordered Sony 46 xbr6 with Sony 550 Blue player one month age.The order is very simple online with security protect.Both of products are running perfect at my home!The delivery was fast than I thought (only three day I got a call for setup schedule).The only thing is that I have to prepare the screw driver to fix four screws on the LCD TV.The delivery man did know how to hold the Sony xbr 6 TV to carry. Do not hold the bottom of TV!!! See the instructions page 6. (I donot know cut and paste the pictures)Anyway, Amazon is best and trust seller!!!

Reviews.Title: Spectacular Picture, Mysterious Sound Problem
Reviews.Author: Stephen Langenthal
Reviews.Content: The picture on this set is the most remarkable I have ever seen and I have been watching television since 1939. It does have one strange problem. When connected to Time Warner cable in New York City,the sound goes off for a few seconds at irregular intervals - it could be once every five minutes or it could be once an hour. If the same HDMI input is used for the Blu Ray player there is no problem. Nor is there a problem if the Time Warner box is connected to a 22 inch Sony High definition set. Sony has no idea what to do.

Reviews.Title: A new World
Reviews.Author: William A. Moss "From time to time reader"
Reviews.Content: Sony Bravia 46 inch is a great T.V. So far I am delighted.Would prefer to comment after a longer period of use time.

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV
Reviews.Author: F. J. Sanchez
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV, I cannot be happier with this purchase. Colors, features, everything is nice with this set.My Home Theater set.KDL-46XBR6STR-DA3400ESPS3

Reviews.Title: Great Product/Lousy Shipping
Reviews.Author: E. Marie Berg
Reviews.Content: Love my new telelvision but the people Amazon sent to deliver it were really obtuse.  They set it up but could not figure out why the picture was so poor.  Took me two weeks to get it fixed.

Reviews.Title: KDL46XBR6  "HELL FREAKIN YEAH"
Reviews.Author: Robert kirby "HD JUNKY"
Reviews.Content: YO MAN LISTEN..THER ARE NOT MANY TV'S OUT THERE BETTER THAN THIS ONE.1080P 120HZ AND 50,000;1 DYNAMIC CONTRAST, COMBINE THOSE THREE THINGS AND YOU'LL NEARLY HAVE THE MOTHER OF ALL TV'S. WHEN IT COMES TO HD TV'S I REALY DID MY HOMEWORK.BESTBUYS WEB SITE IS A QUICK AND EASY WAY TO FIND OUT AND COMPARE ALL OF THE EXACT PRODUCT DISCRIPTIONS...SONY MAKES ANOTHER MODEL OF THIS SAME TV IT HAS A MILLION TO 1 DYNAMIC CONTRAST RATIO,IT WILL RUN YOU ABOUT 5,000.THE KDL46XBR6 IS GOING FOR 2,700 IN MOST PLACES. I WAS ABLE TO GET IT ON AMAZON.COM FOR ABOUT 1,750..1,900 WHEN IT WAS ALL SAID AND DONE. WHAT A GREAT DEAL FOR THIS LEVEL OF TECHNOLOGY..PEOPLE COME INTO MY LIVINGROOM AND THEY ARE JUST BLOWN  AWAY BY THE STUNNING VISIUALS! BUILT IN HD TUNNER!(THIS TV CAN INTERCEPT ON DEMAND DIGITAL CABLE OR SATILITE SIGNLS FROM THE SET TOP BOXES OF YOUR NEAR BY RESIDENTS)...YES I DIDN'T BELIEVE IT BUT ITS TRUE. YOU DONT EVEN NEED TO HAVE CABLE OR SATILITE,ALL YOU NEED IS THIS TV AND YOU CAN JUST WATCH WHAT EVER THE GUY NEXT DOOR IS WATCHING,SOMETIMES EVEN IN HD, IF THATS WHAT THEY SELECTED FROM THEIR ON DEMAND MENU THATS WHAT THIS TV WILL INTERCEPT,AND SOMEBODY ELSE IS PAYING THE BILL!!!! ONLY DOWN SIDE TO THIS IS IF THEY REWIND FASTFORWARD STOP OR PAUSE THE TV INTERCEPTS THAT TO.THIS ONLY APPLIES TO PEOPLE WHO DONT HAVE AN HD SOURCE...JUST SCREW ANY OLD CABLE WIRE ONTO YOUR RF CONNECTION HIT CHANNEL SEARCH AND"WA-LA".

Reviews.Title: Has no separate Antenna/Cable Inputs
Reviews.Author: Roy Ehman "eecomp"
Reviews.Content: The white glove delivery was smooth and picture and sound were the high quality I expect from Sony. But what a shock when I tried to connect the yagi antenna. On page 12 I was told to "go buy an A/B switch" and on page 46, as if an afterthought, I was told how to "Add Digital Channels" by using my A/B switch to select the antenna and doing another chanel scan (aka "Auto Program"). But FIRST you have to TELL the TV that you have swicched to the Antenna. This is the ONLY method, (nothing on the remote). This is what you have to do any time you want to "pop" over to the off-air local to see if, or enjoy, the program of interest in HD.1. Press "Home" 2. Click three times to the left 2. Click twice up. 3. Press the center button (equivalent to "enter"),4. click once to the right 5, Click once down 6. click "enter" 7. click return three times.I will not be buying another TV in my life time and given that the White Glove crew kindly took away the packing and all the inconvenience to return --- I'm stuck sitting with a multi thousand dollar boat anchor.
